title: Bug 120922: Improve 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor
description: In the XML Report Designer editor, when attempting to switch back to the Layout view after editing in the 'source' view, an error message is displayed: 'Source page is dirty.' The problem is that the user is not provided clear instructions on how to save or discard changes and the error message itself is not very helpful. The dialog box containing the prompt is titled 'Error'.
OB: When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating that the 'Source page is dirty.'
EB: When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, a prompt should be displayed asking the user if they want to save the changes or discard them. The error message indicating that the 'Source page is dirty' should be improved to provide clearer instructions on how to handle the situation.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Switch to the 'source' view.
3. Make some changes to the XML.
4. Try to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Observe the error message 'Source page is dirty'.
6. Verify that the prompt asking the user if they want to save or discard the changes is not displayed.
7. Verify that the error message itself does not provide clear instructions on what to do next.
